Package net.mtrop.doom.graphics

Class Picture

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.mtrop.doom.graphics.Picture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IndexedGraphic, BinaryObject, GraphicObject
    public class Picture
extends Object
implements BinaryObject, GraphicObject, IndexedGraphic
    Doom graphic data stored as column-major indices (patches and most graphics with baked-in offsets). Useful for editing/displaying graphics.
    Author:
    Matthew Tropiano

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface net.mtrop.doom.object.BinaryObject

      • setDimensions

        public void setDimensions​(int width,
                          int height)
        Sets the dimensions of this picture. WARNING: This will clear all of the data in the picture.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the picture in pixels.
        height - the height of the picture in pixels.

        public void setOffsetX​(int offsetX)
        Sets the offset from the center, horizontally, in pixels.
        Parameters:
        offsetX - the new X offset.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the offset is outside the range -32768 to 32767.

      • setPixel

        public void setPixel​(int x,
                     int y,
                     int value)
        Sets the pixel data at a location in the picture. Valid values are in the range of -1 to 255, with 0 to 255 being palette indexes and -1 being translucent pixel information. Values outside this range are CLAMPED into the range.
        Parameters:
        x - picture x-coordinate.
        y - picture y-coordinate.
        value - the value to set.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the offset is outside the range -1 to 255.
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the provided coordinates is outside the graphic.

      • getPixel

        public int getPixel​(int x,
                    int y)
        Gets the pixel data at a location in the picture.
        Specified by:
        getPixel in interface IndexedGraphic
        Parameters:
        x - picture x-coordinate.
        y - picture y-coordinate.
        Returns:
        a palette index value from 0 to 255 or PIXEL_TRANSLUCENT if the pixel is not filled in.
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the provided coordinates is outside the graphic.
